text: When the subject turned to terrorism during the presidential debate of 3 March in Detroit, Donald Trump called for it to be harsh on the families of terrorists, not just the terrorists themselves. As an example, he revived an earlier claim - that the wives of the terrorists of 11 September knew what would have happened and fled from the United States to Saudi Arabia just before the attacks. "A man flying at the World Trade Center and his family is being returned to where they were going -- and I think most of you know where they went, and by the way, it wasn't Iraq. But they're back in a certain area. They knew what was going on. The wife knows exactly what was going on, "Trump said. They left early two days in connection with the World Trade Center and went back to where they went and saw her husband on TV flying to the World Trade Center. In part of the response, Trump seems to be talking about one wife, but then he makes it clear that he's talking about all the planes involved in the attack - actually there were four. So in the same breath, he seems to be talking about multiple wives. But it seems clear that Trump wasn't talking about them. The fact that some of these relatives were evacuated from the United States to protect them does not make what Trump said during Fox's discussion more precise. Trump's claim is wrong.
